channel.title: Who uses IntelliJ?
channel.description:
Well, I'm trying to included a folder in my project. And since every folder in the directory of your project is a package to IDEA, well.. You can assume the rest of that one.
So, I've been fooling with the settings, but can't quite find what I'm looking for. I guess I'll also have to tell IDEA that the folder isn't a package as well because then it'll just scream errors.
Can anyone provides some help, please? :] Thanks.

item.title: Who uses IntelliJ?
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

I use idea because it’s interface is much nicer. I’ve also been using it since 2.0. Also, I am severely dependent upon a vi[m] style editor. Idea’s vim plugin is fantastic. Eclipse has one but it is quite low quality. MyEclipse is also ok, but again the lack of native vim support really irks me.

Read full topic

item.title: Who uses IntelliJ?
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Fk, get eclipse.

Read full topic

item.title: Who uses IntelliJ?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I don’t want to exclude the files from compilation. It just doesn’t see them in other packages ;(

So, unless there is another way, I just took the packaging off of the class I wanted to use the files in and it works.

/confused

Read full topic

item.title: Who uses IntelliJ?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

File->Settings->Project Settings->Compiler->Exclude from Compile

On a side note, my copy of IDEA can’t handle large numbers of files without freezing to allocate more memory every few minutes. Eclipse is much less of a hit on my system. Anyone else have that problem?

Read full topic
